column2: Parliament clearly showing an intention to lay a burden on him."

column1: [55] In Russell v. Scott, I9481. A.C. 422. 58, Lord Simonds observed on page

column2: "My  Lords,  there  is  a  maxim  of  income-tax  law  which,  though  it  may
sometimes  be  overstressed,  yet  ought  not  to  be  forgotten.  It  is  that
the subject is  not  to  be  taxed  unless  the  words  of  the  taxing  statute
maxim should on occasion be reasserted and this is such an occasion."
